content.text: is designed to process spanned meter billing data for ConEdison. It performs two main tasks: first, it inputs spanned data into a temporary table, and second, it processes these records to generate final billing records, which are then inserted into a summary table. The procedure handles complex calculations related to gas usage over multiple billing periods, including adjustments for meter rollovers and prorating usage and billing amounts across periods.
The complexity of this stored procedure is high due to several factors:
It involves multiple steps and complex calculations for prorating billing data across multiple periods.
It uses a cursor to iterate over records, which adds to the complexity and potential performance issues.
It includes numerous variable declarations and calculations, including calls to user-defined functions for business logic.
The procedure handles intricate business rules related to meter readings, billing periods, and adjustments for meter rollovers.
This stored procedure does not take any input parameters. It operates on data already present in the

The procedure begins by truncating the
table to remove any existing data.

is greater than 1, indicating spanned billing periods.
A cursor is declared to iterate over records in the temporary spanned summary table.
For each record, it buffers column values into local variables for processing.
It calculates the total gas spanned billed percentage and initializes counters for prorating usage and billing amounts.
It performs calculations to determine meter rollovers and prorates the usage and billing amounts across periods.
It inserts the processed data into the
table, including detailed notes on the calculations performed.
: The use of a cursor can lead to performance bottlenecks, especially with large datasets, as it processes records row-by-row.
: The procedure performs numerous calculations and calls to user-defined functions, which can be resource-intensive.
: Truncating the temporary table and reseeding the identity column can be costly operations if performed frequently.
: The procedure truncates a table and reseeds its identity, which could lead to concurrency issues if multiple instances of the procedure are run simultaneously.
: There is no explicit error handling in the procedure, which could lead to unhandled exceptions and data inconsistencies.
: The use of a cursor and complex calculations may not scale well with large volumes of data, potentially leading to long execution times.
: The procedure assumes that the data in the source table is accurate and complete. Any anomalies in the source data could lead to incorrect billing calculations.

Overall, this stored procedure is a critical component of the billing process, handling complex business logic and calculations to ensure accurate billing for spanned meter periods. However, its complexity and potential performance issues warrant careful monitoring and optimization.

CREATE PROCEDURE [ConEd].[usp_Upload_12_ProcessSpannedMeterBilling]
AS 
BEGIN
	/*
	Steps:
	1) Input spanned data into UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpanned
	2) Process spanned records, put final records into UploadConEdisonMeterSummary
	*/

	/*
	1) Input spanned data into 
	*/
        BEGIN
            TRUNCATE TABLE ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpanned
            DBCC CHECKIDENT ('ConEd.[UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpanned]', RESEED,1)

            INSERT  INTO ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpanned
                    ( title ,
                      AccountNumber ,
                      MeterNumber ,
                      BillingPeriod ,
                      BillingPeriodRevision ,
                      FirstPeriodCanceled ,
                      FromDate ,
                      ToDate ,
                      ThermFactor ,
                      CCF ,
                      DeltaNumberOfPeriods ,
                      ReadingCode ,
                      FromReading ,
                      ToReading ,
                      MeterConstant ,
                      TripNumber ,
                      Dials ,
                      FacilityName ,
                      ServiceAddress
                    )
                    SELECT  'SpannedMeterbilling' AS title ,
                            AccountNumber ,
                            MeterNumber ,
                            BillingPeriod ,
                            BillingPeriodRevision ,
                            FirstPeriodCanceled ,
                            FromDate ,
                            ToDate ,
                            ThermFactor ,
                            CCF ,
                            DeltaNumberOfPeriods ,
                            ReadingCode ,
                            FromReading ,
                            ToReading ,
                            MeterConstant ,
                            CASE WHEN CycleBillingDays > 99 THEN 99 ELSE CycleBillingDays END ,  -- Trip Number
                            Dials ,
                            FacilityName ,
                            ServiceAddress
                    FROM ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeter
                    WHERE   ( DeltaNumberOfPeriods > 1 )
  
  

        END -- end 1  

	/*
	2) Process spanned records, put final records into UploadConEdisonMeterSummary
	*/
        BEGIN
		
            DECLARE @UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpannedSeqid dbo.seqid
--
            DECLARE @Notes dbo.notes
            DECLARE @AccountNumber dbo.acctnum
            DECLARE @FacilityName dbo.UtilityServiceAccountName
            DECLARE @ServiceAddress dbo.addr
            DECLARE @TariffCode dbo.tariff
            DECLARE @PostingDate dbo.PostingDate
--
            DECLARE @OriginalMeterNumber meternumber 
            DECLARE @GasRateCode GasRateCode 
            DECLARE @MeterFromReading MeterReadingNumber7 
            DECLARE @MeterToReading MeterReadingNumber7 
            DECLARE @MeterConstant MeterConstantMultiplier 
            DECLARE @ReadingCode ReadingCode 
            DECLARE @NumberOfDials MeterDials 
--
            DECLARE @NumberOfPeriodsMinusOne dbo.Accumulator
            DECLARE @DeltaNumberOfPeriods dbo.Accumulator
            DECLARE @BillingPeriod dbo.yyyymm 
            DECLARE @FirstPeriodCanceled dbo.yyyymm 
            DECLARE @ThermFactor dbo.ThermsFactor 
            DECLARE @FudgedThermFactor dbo.ThermsFactor 
            DECLARE @BillingPeriodRevision dbo.yyyymm 
            DECLARE @FromDate dbo.yyyymmdd 
            DECLARE @ToDate dbo.yyyymmdd 
            DECLARE @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision dbo.yyyymm 
            DECLARE @CalculatedFromDate dbo.yyyymmdd 
            DECLARE @CalculatedToDate dbo.yyyymmdd 
            DECLARE @BilledAmount dbo.BillingAmt 
            DECLARE @BilledAmountMonthly dbo.BillingAmt 
            DECLARE @BilledAmountAverage dbo.BillingAmt 
            DECLARE @BilledAmountRemainder dbo.BillingAmt 
            DECLARE @BillingPeriodDays dbo.Accumulator 
            DECLARE @BillingPeriodDaysAverage dbo.Accumulator 
            DECLARE @BillingPeriodDaysRemainder dbo.Accumulator 
            DECLARE @Therms dbo.EnergyUnit 
            DECLARE @LastPeriodTherms dbo.EnergyUnit 
            DECLARE @ThermsAverage dbo.EnergyUnit 
            DECLARE @ThermsRemainder dbo.EnergyUnit 
            DECLARE @CCF dbo.EnergyUnit 
            DECLARE @CCFAverage dbo.EnergyUnit 
            DECLARE @CCFRemainder dbo.EnergyUnit 
            DECLARE @SumAverageCCF dbo.EnergyUnit 
            DECLARE @idx INT
            DECLARE @StartingBillingPeriodDaysIncrement INT
            DECLARE @StartingBillingPeriodCCFIncrement INT
            DECLARE @StartingBillingPeriodThermsIncrement INT
            DECLARE @IncrementBillingPeriodDays INT
            DECLARE @IncrementBillingPeriodCCF INT
            DECLARE @IncrementBillingPeriodTherms INT
--
            DECLARE @MeterRolloverAdjustmentFactor INT
            DECLARE @NumberOfDialsAdjustmentFactor INT
            DECLARE @MeterHasRolledOver BIT

--
            DECLARE @ThermsMonthlyLastPeriod dbo.EnergyUnit 
            DECLARE @CCFMonthlyLastPeriod dbo.EnergyUnit 

            DECLARE @CalculatedMeterFromReading INT 
            DECLARE @CalculatedMeterToReading INT
            DECLARE @CalculatedMeterConstant DECIMAL(7, 1)
--
            DECLARE @ConEdUtilityCode dbo.seqid
            DECLARE @ApplyMonthlyPercentage dbo.DiscountPercentage
            DECLARE @ThermsMonthlySum dbo.EnergyUnit 
            DECLARE @ThermsMonthly dbo.EnergyUnit 
            DECLARE @CCFMonthly dbo.EnergyUnit 
            DECLARE @CCFMonthlySum dbo.EnergyUnit 
            DECLARE @TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage dbo.DiscountPercentage
            DECLARE @BillingCycle dbo.MonthlyBillingCycle
            DECLARE @BillingDate dbo.yyyymmdd
--
--
--**************************************************************************************  
--SET DEFAULTS                                                  
--**************************************************************************************
--
--SELECT @BillingPeriod = BillingPeriod FROM ApplicationTimeFrame WHERE (CurrentProcessingPeriod = 'Y')
--
--Set @BillingPeriod = '200607'
            SELECT TOP 1
                    @BillingPeriod = BillingPeriod
            FROM ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeter
--
            SET @BillingCycle = 'M'
            SET @ConEdUtilityCode = 9
--
--**************************************************************************************  
--Main Process                                      
--**************************************************************************************
--
--	DECLARE a cursor to find all account bills that span more than one period.
--
            DECLARE SpannedGasBillCursor CURSOR
            FOR
                SELECT  UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpannedSeqid
                FROM ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpanned
                WHERE   ( DeltaNumberOfPeriods > 1 ) --and @BillingPeriod=@BillingPeriod
--
            OPEN SpannedGasBillCursor;
--
            FETCH NEXT FROM SpannedGasBillCursor INTO @UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpannedSeqid
--
-- Check @@FETCH_STATUS to see if there are any more rows to fetch.
--
            WHILE @@FETCH_STATUS = 0 
                BEGIN
	--
	--	Buffer all of the columns from the spanned row for parsing purposes
	--
	--
                    SELECT  @AccountNumber = AccountNumber ,
                            @OriginalMeterNumber = MeterNumber ,
                            @MeterFromReading = ISNULL(FromReading, 0) ,
                            @MeterToReading = ISNULL(ToReading, 0) ,
                            @MeterConstant = ISNULL(CASE WHEN MeterConstant = 0 THEN 1 ELSE MeterConstant END, 1) ,
                            @ReadingCode = ReadingCode ,
                            @NumberOfDials = Dials ,
                            @DeltaNumberOfPeriods = DeltaNumberOfPeriods ,
                            @BillingPeriodRevision = BillingPeriodRevision ,
                            @FirstPeriodCanceled = FirstPeriodCanceled ,
                            @FromDate = FromDate ,
                            @ToDate = ToDate ,
                            @CCF = CCF ,
                            @ThermFactor = ThermFactor ,
                            @BillingPeriod = BillingPeriod ,
                            @FacilityName = FacilityName ,
                            @ServiceAddress = ServiceAddress
                    FROM ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpanned
                    WHERE   ( UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpannedSeqid = @UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpannedSeqid ) 
	--
	--	Aggregate the average City wide monthly gas usage percentage for the spanned row billing periods 
	--
                    SELECT  @TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage = [dbo].[CalculateTotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage](@BillingCycle,
                                                              @DeltaNumberOfPeriods,
                                                              @FirstPeriodCanceled,
                                                              @BillingPeriodRevision)
	--
	--	Determine the number of periods minus 1 to pro-rate the money and usage.  The last period will derive the money and usage
	--	by row totals - (the n-1 aggregates of money and usage)
	--
                    SET @NumberOfPeriodsMinusOne = @DeltaNumberOfPeriods - 1
	--
	--	Initialize the counters for the n-1 parses
	--
                    SET @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision = @FirstPeriodCanceled
                    SET @CalculatedFromDate = @FromDate
                    SET @CalculatedToDate = @ToDate
                    SET @idx = 0
                    SET @ThermsMonthlySum = 0
                    SET @CCFMonthlySum = 0
                    SET @CalculatedMeterFromReading = CAST(@MeterFromReading AS INT)
                    SET @CalculatedMeterToReading = CAST(@MeterToReading AS INT)
                    SET @CalculatedMeterConstant = CAST(@MeterConstant AS DECIMAL(7,
                                                              1))

	--
                    SELECT  @ThermFactor = dbo.DetermineConEdisonGetThermFactorFromAccountTable(@AccountNumber,
                                                              @BillingPeriodRevision)
                    SELECT  @GasRateCode = dbo.DetermineConEdisonGetGasTariffRateFromAccountTable(@AccountNumber,
                                                              @BillingPeriodRevision)
                    SELECT  @BillingDate = dbo.ConvertDatetimeToYYYYMMDD(dbo.[DetermineConEdisonGetPostingDateFromAccountTable](@AccountNumber,
                                                              @BillingPeriodRevision))
	--
                    SET @Therms = ROUND(@CCF * @ThermFactor, 0)
	--
                    SET @NumberOfDialsAdjustmentFactor = CASE 
											-- Standard Gas meter has from 3 to 6 dials.  
                                                              WHEN 2 < @NumberOfDials
                                                              AND @NumberOfDials < 7
                                                              THEN CAST(@NumberOfDials AS INT)
											-- If there are no dials reported or the number of dials is outside the 
											-- range of the standard number of dials (3 to 6 dials).  The sum of the 
											-- MeterFromReading + total CCF will derive a number that is equal to the 
											-- number of dials - 1 raised to the power of 10 plus the MeterToReading.
                                                              ELSE LEN(CAST(@CCF
                                                              + @CalculatedMeterFromReading AS VARCHAR(7)))
                                                              - 1
                                                         END
                    SET @MeterHasRolledOver = 0
                    SET @MeterRolloverAdjustmentFactor = POWER(10,
                                                              @NumberOfDialsAdjustmentFactor)
                    IF ( @CalculatedMeterToReading < @CalculatedMeterFromReading
                         OR POWER(10, @NumberOfDialsAdjustmentFactor) <= @CCF
                       ) 
                        BEGIN
                            SET @MeterHasRolledOver = 1
                        END
	--
	--
                    WHILE ( @NumberOfPeriodsMinusOne > @idx ) 
                        BEGIN
			--
			-- The @ApplyMonthlyPercentage holds the weigthed average for the particular month
			--
                            SELECT  @ApplyMonthlyPercentage = [dbo].[CalculateApplyMonthlyPercentageGasSpannedBilled](@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,
                                                              @TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage)
			--
			-- Apply the Monthly Percentage to the meter reading and derive the CCF, Therms  and accumulate the weigthed average units.
			--
                            SET @CCFMonthly = ROUND(@CCF
                                                    * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,
                                                    0)
                            SET @CCFMonthlySum = @CCFMonthlySum + @CCFMonthly
                            SET @ThermsMonthly = ROUND(@Therms
                                                       * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,
                                                       0)
                            SET @ThermsMonthlySum = @ThermsMonthlySum
                                + @ThermsMonthly
			--
			--	The CCF, Therms and Meter To Reading are derived.  The CCF
			--
                            SET @CalculatedMeterToReading = @CalculatedMeterFromReading
                                + ROUND(@CCFMonthly / @CalculatedMeterConstant,
                                        0)
                            SET @CalculatedMeterToReading = CASE
                                                              WHEN @MeterHasRolledOver = 0
                                                              THEN @CalculatedMeterToReading
                                                              ELSE 
												 -- 
												 -- The spanned meter reading has rolled over.  If the MeterToReading is less than @NumberOfDialsAdjustmentFactor then 
												 -- the derived MeterToReading remains unadjusted. When the sum of the @CalculatedMeterFromReading + @CCFMonthly is greater
												 -- than the @NumberOfDialsAdjustmentFactor is subtracted to make the adjustment for the rollover meter reset.
												 -- 
                                                              CASE
                                                              WHEN @CalculatedMeterToReading < @MeterRolloverAdjustmentFactor
                                                              THEN @CalculatedMeterToReading
                                                              ELSE @CalculatedMeterToReading
                                                              - @MeterRolloverAdjustmentFactor
                                                              END
                                                            END
			--
			--	The Billing Period Projected "ToDate" is derived from the table "dbo.BillingPeriodProjected" using the utility company seqid and the
			--	RevisedBillingPeriod and using the "EndofPeriodTodate" as the derived "Todate" for the account.
			--
                            SELECT  @CalculatedToDate = [dbo].[DetermineConEdisonBillingPeriodProjectedToDate](@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,
                                                              @TariffCode,
                                                              @ConEdUtilityCode)
			--
                            PRINT @AccountNumber + ' '
                                + @BillingPeriodRevision + ' ' + @FromDate
                                + ' ' + @ToDate
			--
			--	Create a custom note that explains how the information was parsed and what was the original information of the spanned row.
			--	It will note in EC3 that the transaction was derived.
			--
                            SELECT  @Notes = 'CalcTherm '
                                    + CAST(@Therms AS VARCHAR(10)) + ' = '
                                    + CAST(@ThermFactor AS VARCHAR(6)) + ' * '
                                    + CAST(@CCF AS VARCHAR(10)) + ' for '
                                    + CAST(@DeltaNumberOfPeriods AS VARCHAR(6))
                                    + ' periods, First: '
                                    + @FirstPeriodCanceled + ' ( '
                                    + @MeterFromReading + ') Last: '
                                    + @BillingPeriodRevision + ' ( '
                                    + @MeterToReading + '). ' + ' period: '
                                    + @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision
                                    + ' Month %: '
                                    + CAST(@ApplyMonthlyPercentage AS VARCHAR(10))
                                    + ' - Total %: '
                                    + CAST(@TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage AS VARCHAR(10))
			--
			--	INSERT the data into the table "ConEd.UploadConEdisonAccountSummary"
			--
                            INSERT  INTO ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterSummary
                                    ( AccountUtilityCompanySeqid ,
                                      OriginalAccountNumber ,
                                      OriginalMeterNumber ,
                                      NumberOfTransactions ,
                                      NumberOfRebillTransactions ,
                                      NumberOfCancelTransactions ,
                                      BillingPeriod ,
                                      BillingPeriodRevision ,
                                      FirstCancelPeriod ,
                                      BillingAction ,
                                      InitialCancelFromDate ,
                                      CurrentBillingToDate ,
                                      GasRateCode ,
                                      FromDate ,
                                      ToDate ,
                                      MeterFromReading ,
                                      MeterToReading ,
                                      Ccf ,
                                      Therms ,
                                      ThermsFactor ,
                                      MeterConstant ,
                                      TotalBillingDaysRebilled ,
                                      NumberOfBillingPeriods ,
                                      BillingDays ,
                                      BillingDate ,
                                      ReadingCode ,
                                      NumberOfDials ,
                                      MeterType ,
                                      ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod ,
                                      ProcessEffectiveDate ,
                                      InitialPostingDate ,
                                      AuthenticatedUserID ,
                                      Notes ,
                                      DerivedFromSpannedBill ,
                                      SpannedBillingPeriodRevision ,
                                      SpannedFirstCanceledBillingPeriod ,
                                      SpannedCCF ,
                                      SpannedThermFactor ,
                                      SpannedTherm ,
                                      SpannedMonthlyPercentage ,
                                      SpannedTotalPercentage ,
                                      EstimatedOrActualBilling ,
                                      FacilityName ,
                                      ServiceAddress
				                    )
                                    SELECT  @ConEdUtilityCode ,
                                            @AccountNumber ,
                                            @OriginalMeterNumber ,
                                            1 ,-- NumberOfTransactions, 
                                            1 ,-- NumberOfRebillTransactions,
                                            0 ,-- NumberOfCancelTransactions,
                                            @BillingPeriod ,
                                            @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision ,
                                            @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision ,
                                            CASE WHEN @BillingPeriod = @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision
                                                 THEN 'O'
                                                 ELSE 'A'
                                            END ,-- BillingAction, 
                                            @CalculatedFromDate ,
                                            @CalculatedToDate ,
                                            @GasRateCode ,
                                            @CalculatedFromDate ,
                                            @CalculatedToDate ,
                                            CAST(@CalculatedMeterFromReading AS VARCHAR(7)) ,  --dbo.MeterReadingNumber
                                            CAST(@CalculatedMeterToReading AS VARCHAR(7)) ,  --dbo.MeterReadingNumber
                                            @CCFMonthly ,
                                            @ThermsMonthly ,
                                            @ThermFactor ,
                                            @MeterConstant ,
                                            [dbo].[CalculateNumberOfBillingDays](@CalculatedFromDate,
                                                              @CalculatedToDate) ,
                                            1 ,
                                            [dbo].[CalculateNumberOfBillingDays](@CalculatedFromDate,
                                                              @CalculatedToDate) ,
                                            @BillingDate ,
                                            @ReadingCode ,
                                            @NumberOfDials ,
                                            'G' , -- MeterType,
                                            'N' , --ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod
                                            [dbo].ConvertDateToYYYYMMDD(GETDATE()) , -- ProcessEffectiveDate
                                            GETDATE() , -- InitialPostingDate
                                            1 , --	AuthenticatedUserID,
                                            @Notes ,
                                            'Y' , -- DerivedFromSpannedBill
                                            @BillingPeriodRevision ,  -- SpannedBillingPeriodRevision
                                            @FirstPeriodCanceled ,  -- SpannedFirstPeriodCanceled
                                            @CCF ,  -- SpannedCCF
                                            @ThermFactor ,  -- SpannedThermFactor
                                            @Therms ,  -- SpannedTherms
                                            @ApplyMonthlyPercentage ,  -- SpannedApplyMonthlyPercentage
                                            @TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage ,  -- SpannedTotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage
                                            --CASE WHEN @ReadingCode < 15 THEN 'EST' ELSE 'ACT' END , -- EstimatedOrActualBilling
                                            dbo.CalculateEstimatedOrActual(@ReadingCode,9)
											,FacilityName ,
                                            ServiceAddress
                                    FROM ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpanned
                                    WHERE   ( UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpannedSeqid = @UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpannedSeqid ) 
			--
			--	Set up for the next the Revised Billing Period row.
			--
                            SET @SumAverageCCF = @SumAverageCCF + @CCFAverage 	  
                            SET @idx = @idx + 1
			--
			--	Calculate the next the Revised Billing Period row.
                            SELECT  @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision = [dbo].[CalculateNextBillingPeriod](@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,
                                                              @BillingCycle)
			--	This will derive the new Revised Billing Period row's "FromDate"
                            SELECT  @CalculatedFromDate = [dbo].[DetermineConEdisonBillingPeriodProjectedFromDate](@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,
                                                              @TariffCode,
                                                              @ConEdUtilityCode)
			--
                            SELECT  @CalculatedMeterFromReading = @CalculatedMeterToReading 
			-- Cast(@CalculatedMeterFromReading as dbo.MeterReadingNumber)
			--	Process the next Revised Billing Period row
			--
                        END
	--
	--	Finish up the last period's processing
	--
	--	Use the (Nth -1) periods @CalculatedToDate as the "FromDate" and the acutal "ToDate" from the spanned record as the "ToDate"
	--
                    SELECT  @CalculatedFromDate = @CalculatedToDate
                    SELECT  @CalculatedToDate = @ToDate
	--
	--	Use the (Nth -1) periods Calculated Meter From Reading as the "MeterFromReading" and the acutal "MeterToReading" from the spanned record as the "MeterToReading"
	--
                    SELECT  @CalculatedMeterFromReading = @CalculatedMeterToReading 
                    SELECT  @CalculatedMeterToReading = CAST(@MeterToReading AS INT)
	--
	--	@ApplyMonthlyPercentage is used for the notes purposes only
	--
                    SELECT  @ApplyMonthlyPercentage = [dbo].[CalculateApplyMonthlyPercentageGasSpannedBilled](@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,
                                                              @TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage)
	--
	--	Derive the net changes to avoid rounding errors
	--
--	set @BilledAmountMonthlyLastPeriod = @BilledAmount - @BilledAmountMonthlySum
                    SET @ThermsMonthlyLastPeriod = @Therms - @ThermsMonthlySum
                    SET @CCFMonthlyLastPeriod = @CCF - @CCFMonthlySum
	--
	--	print @AccountNumber+' '+@BillingPeriodRevision+' '+@FromDate+' '+@ToDate
	--
	--
	--	Create a custom note that explains how the information was parsed and what was the original information of the spanned row.
	--	It will note in EC3 that the transaction was derived.
	--
                    SELECT  @Notes = 'CalcTherm '
                            + CAST(@Therms AS VARCHAR(10)) + ' = '
                            + CAST(@ThermFactor AS VARCHAR(6)) + ' * '
                            + CAST(@CCF AS VARCHAR(10)) + ' for '
                            + CAST(@DeltaNumberOfPeriods AS VARCHAR(6))
                            + ' periods, First: ' + @FirstPeriodCanceled
                            + ' ( ' + @MeterFromReading + ') Last: '
                            + @BillingPeriodRevision + ' ( ' + @MeterToReading
                            + '). ' + ' period: '
                            + @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision + ' Month %: '
                            + CAST(@ApplyMonthlyPercentage AS VARCHAR(10))
                            + ' - Total %: '
                            + CAST(@TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage AS VARCHAR(10))
	--
	--	INSERT the data into the table "ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterSummary"
	--
                    INSERT  INTO ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterSummary
                            ( AccountUtilityCompanySeqid ,
                              OriginalAccountNumber ,
                              OriginalMeterNumber ,
                              NumberOfTransactions ,
                              NumberOfRebillTransactions ,
                              NumberOfCancelTransactions ,
                              BillingPeriod ,
                              BillingPeriodRevision ,
                              FirstCancelPeriod ,
                              BillingAction ,
                              InitialCancelFromDate ,
                              CurrentBillingToDate ,
                              GasRateCode ,
                              FromDate ,
                              ToDate ,
                              MeterFromReading ,
                              MeterToReading ,
                              Ccf ,
                              Therms ,
                              ThermsFactor ,
                              MeterConstant ,
                              TotalBillingDaysRebilled ,
                              NumberOfBillingPeriods ,
                              BillingDays ,
                              BillingDate ,
                              ReadingCode ,
                              NumberOfDials ,
                              MeterType ,
                              ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod ,
                              ProcessEffectiveDate ,
                              InitialPostingDate ,
                              AuthenticatedUserID ,
                              Notes ,
                              DerivedFromSpannedBill ,
                              SpannedBillingPeriodRevision ,
                              SpannedFirstCanceledBillingPeriod ,
                              SpannedCCF ,
                              SpannedThermFactor ,
                              SpannedTherm ,
                              SpannedMonthlyPercentage ,
                              SpannedTotalPercentage ,
                              EstimatedOrActualBilling ,
                              FacilityName ,
                              ServiceAddress
		                    )
                            SELECT  @ConEdUtilityCode ,
                                    @AccountNumber ,
                                    @OriginalMeterNumber ,
                                    1 ,-- NumberOfTransactions, 
                                    1 ,-- NumberOfRebillTransactions,
                                    0 ,-- NumberOfCancelTransactions,
                                    @BillingPeriod ,
                                    @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision ,
                                    @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision ,
                                    CASE WHEN @BillingPeriod = @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision
                                         THEN 'O'
                                         ELSE 'A'
                                    END ,-- BillingAction, 
                                    @CalculatedFromDate ,
                                    @CalculatedToDate ,
                                    @GasRateCode ,
                                    @CalculatedFromDate ,
                                    @CalculatedToDate ,
                                    CAST(@CalculatedMeterFromReading AS VARCHAR(7)) ,  --dbo.MeterReadingNumber
                                    CAST(@CalculatedMeterToReading AS VARCHAR(7)) ,  --dbo.MeterReadingNumber
                                    @CCFMonthlyLastPeriod ,
                                    @ThermsMonthlyLastPeriod ,
                                    @ThermFactor ,
                                    @MeterConstant ,
                                    [dbo].[CalculateNumberOfBillingDays](@CalculatedFromDate,
                                                              @CalculatedToDate) ,
                                    1 ,
                                    [dbo].[CalculateNumberOfBillingDays](@CalculatedFromDate,
                                                              @CalculatedToDate) ,
                                    @BillingDate ,
                                    @ReadingCode ,
                                    @NumberOfDials ,
                                    'G' , -- MeterType,
                                    'N' , --ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod
                                    [dbo].ConvertDateToYYYYMMDD(GETDATE()) , -- ProcessEffectiveDate
                                    GETDATE() , -- InitialPostingDate
                                    1 , --	AuthenticatedUserID,
                                    @Notes ,
                                    'Y' , -- DerivedFromSpannedBill
                                    @BillingPeriodRevision ,  -- SpannedBillingPeriodRevision
                                    @FirstPeriodCanceled ,  -- SpannedFirstPeriodCanceled
                                    @CCF ,  -- SpannedCCF
                                    @ThermFactor ,  -- SpannedThermFactor
                                    @Therms ,  -- SpannedTherms
                                    @ApplyMonthlyPercentage ,  -- SpannedApplyMonthlyPercentage
                                    @TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage ,  -- SpannedTotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage
                                    --CASE WHEN @ReadingCode < 15 THEN 'EST' ELSE 'ACT' END  -- EstimatedOrActualBilling
									dbo.CalculateEstimatedOrActual(@ReadingCode,9)
                                    ,FacilityName ,
                                    ServiceAddress
                            FROM ConEd.UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpanned
                            WHERE   ( UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpannedSeqid = @UploadConEdisonMeterTempSummarySpannedSeqid ) 
	--
